alert.note: Alert for Grundy; Kendall; Northern Will; Southern Will (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 27 at 9:22AM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Kendall, northwestern Will and eastern Grundy Counties through 1000 AM CST... At 922 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles east of Newark to Gardner. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Oswego and Coal City around 935 AM CST. Aurora, Naperville, Plainfield, Channahon, Minooka and Boulder Hill around 940 AM CST. Joliet around 945 AM CST. Shorewood around 950 AM CST. Other locations impacted by these storms include Plattville and Carbon Hill. Including the following interstates... I-55 between mile markers 241 and 254. I-80 between mile markers 112 and 128. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Grundy; Kendall; Northern Will; Southern Will
